conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for checking in.

As of Round 13, I have **not** received any new [APPLY] or other active engagement from Student_A, Student_C, Student_B, or Student_E that would change our plan.

So, our approach is **unchanged**: we will continue to hold the seat through Round 14, and **at the start of Round 15**, if we still have not received an [APPLY] from any of those higher-priority candidates, I will message you promptly to invite your [APPLY] at that time.

If anything changes before then (i.e., a higher-priority candidate applies), I will be transparent with you.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority list ranks Student_D last, and I prefer to keep the seat open while higher-priority candidates (Student_A, Student_C, Student_B, Student_E) remain potentially available. In Round 12 I set a clear decision point: hold until the start of Round 15 unless a higher-priority student applies earlier. In Round 13, Student_D is only [TALK] and asks whether anything changed. I should respond transparently: no new engagement from higher-priority candidates this round, plan unchanged, and reiterate that I’ll invite an [APPLY] at Round 15 if still no higher-priority applicants. This preserves my ability to match higher on my list while maintaining credibility with Student_D.

conversation.thought: School_E’s true priority ranks Student_D last, and we prefer leaving the seat unfilled over taking someone not on the list (Student_D is on the list but lowest). Also, higher-priority students may still be unmatched and could apply later; their own preferences place School_E last, but late-round fallback is possible. conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for following the plan we set.

As we have reached Round 15 without an [APPLY] from the higher-priority candidates we were holding the seat for, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. Please confirm you will enroll and withdraw from other conversations as you indicated.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and true priority list A > C > B > E > D. Student_D is last on our list but still acceptable. Through Round 14 we received no engagement from A/C/B/E, and we explicitly set Round 15 as the decision point to move to the next candidate. Student_D has now applied in Round 15 with a commitment to enroll. Holding longer risks ending unmatched if higher-priority students never apply (and School_E is last choice for all students, so probability of late application is low). Accepting D now secures a match and satisfies our stated commitment, and D is included in our acceptable list, so better than leaving seat empty.
